item.title: Learning Python
item.description: Something that I was looking forward to when taking SDS 348 was learning how to use python. Python is a programming language that can be used for websites, web applications and common programming tasks. The best thing about Python is that it can be used on various platforms, one of them being R studio. This can be done by using the package “reticulate” on R as demonstrated below. library(reticulate) Now that reticulate is installed, we can use python on R studio!

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 project 2

title: “Project 2.” output: html_document — Farah Saleem fs7724 #defining functioons class_diag<-function(probs,truth){ tab<-table(factor(probs>.5,levels=c("FALSE","TRUE")),truth) acc=sum(diag(tab))/sum(tab) sens=tab[2,2]/colSums(tab)[2] spec=tab[1,1]/colSums(tab)[1] ppv=tab[2,2]/rowSums(tab)[2] if(is.numeric(truth)==FALSE & is.logical(truth)==FALSE) truth<-as.numeric(truth)-1 ord<-order(probs, decreasing=TRUE) probs <- probs[ord]; truth <- truth[ord] TPR=cumsum(truth)/max(1,sum(truth)) FPR=cumsum(!truth)/max(1,sum(!truth)) dup<-c(probs[-1]>=probs[-length(probs)], FALSE) TPR<-c(0,TPR[!dup],1); FPR<-c(0,FPR[!dup],1) n <- length(TPR) auc<- sum( ((TPR[-1]+TPR[-n])/2) * (FPR[-1]-FPR[-n]) ) data.frame(acc,sens,spec,ppv,auc) } ##Defining the dataset library("MASS") survey1<-na.omit(survey) This dataset is based on a college survey. The categorical variable is Exercise which has 3 groups: Left, Right and Neither.

item.title: Project
item.description: ##Introduction: I chose the datasets survey and uggs because they included college student data which was really interesting and relevant to me as a college student myself. They contain variables such as piercing,tattoos and sleeping patterns along with age, height and smoking status. I chose both of these from packages installed in R. library("MASS") library(VGAMdata) library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following object is masked from 'package:MASS': ## ## select ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) library(tidyr) library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.
